ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Parent: My child is shy when talking to an unfamiliar person / Self: I am shy when I have to talk to an unfamiliar person
My child is shy when talking to an unfamiliar child
Parent: My child talks easily with an unfamiliar person / Self: I talk easily to an unfamiliar person
My child talks easily with an unfamiliar child
Parent: My child feels nervous when he/she has to talk to an unfamiliar person / Self: I feel nervous when I have to talk to an unfamiliar person
My child feels nervous when he/she has to talk to an unfamiliar child
Parent: My child feels good and is able to laugh when he/she talks to an unfamiliar person / Self: I feel good an I am able to laugh, when I talk to an unfamiliar person
My child feels good and is able to laugh when he/she talks to an unfamiliar child
Which of the following descriptions best describes your child? (Behavioral Inhibition Categories)
Notes: 1 = As long as I remember, (my child is/I am) shy when he/she has to talk to an unfamiliar person. On such occasions, he/she is nervous, is not able to laugh, and he/she does not know what to say (High behavioral inhibition) ; 2 = As long as I remember, (my child talks/I talk) easily to an unfamiliar person. On such occasions, he/she feels good, is able to laugh, and he/she knows precisely what to say (Low behavioral inhibition); 3 = (My child is/I am) someone falling in between 1 and 2 (Middle behavioral inhibition)
4 = Not apprehensive, not shy, and very sociable when meeting an unfamiliar person; 16 = Very apprehensive and shy and not capable of initiating social interaction with an unfamiliar person
